info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 20 at 8:25PM MDT until April 22 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...Red Flag Warning is in effect for Thursday from noon to 9PM for gusty winds and low humidity values for fire weather zones 222, 224, 225, 229, 230, and 233 which includes the San Luis Valley, the Wet Mountain Valley, and Fremont, Huerfano, and Las Animas Counties... ...Fire Weather Watch is in effect for Friday morning through evening for gusty winds and low relative humidity, which includes the San Luis Valley, the Wet Mountain Valley, Fremont and Teller Counties and the rest of the eastern plains... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 9 PM MDT THURSDAY FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 229...230 AND 233... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 229...230 AND 233... * Affected Area...Fire Weather Zones 229...230 and 233. * Winds...for Thursday...South to southeast 15 to 25 mph with gusts to 30 mph. For Friday...South 40 to 50 mph with gusts up to 65 mph. * Timing...For Thursday noon to 9 pm. For Friday 9 AM to 8 PM. * Relative Humidity...As low as 6 percent. * Temperatures...In the 80s. * Impacts...Conditions will be favorable for rapid rates of fire growth and spread.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
